section.name: 7 - Interactions
section.summary:
Objectives

By the end of this topic unit you should be able to:

  • Explain differences between the four basic types of energy and explain how to tell when a system is gaining/losing any specific type of energy.
  • Draw energy bar charts showing how the energy of a system changes during a physical process.
  • Use the law of conservation of energy to solve problems involving closed systems.
  • Use velocity vs. time data to determine whether a collision is elastic, inelastic, totally inelastic or an explosive separation.
  • Use a potential energy vs. position graph to draw conclusions about the likely motion of an object.
